meanings.definition: To thrust forward or impose oneself or one's ideas on others.
meanings.sent1: She obtruded her opinion during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The salesman obtruded his product on the customer.
meanings.sent3: He obtruded into the conversation with his loud voice.
meanings.sent4: The bright neon sign obtruded against the dark night sky.
meanings.sent5: The smell of burnt popcorn obtruded into the room, making everyone cough.

meanings.definition: To force or impose something on someone else.
meanings.sent1: The teacher obtruded extra homework on the students.
meanings.sent2: The dictator obtruded strict rules on the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The cat obtruded its paw under the door to play with the toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm obtruded its powerful winds on the fragile trees.
meanings.sent5: The loud music obtruded through the walls, disturbing the neighbors.

meanings.definition: To intrude or interrupt in an unwelcome or forceful manner.
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors obtruded on our peaceful evening.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected phone call obtruded on her quiet study time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel obtruded into the bird feeder, stealing the seeds.
meanings.sent4: The bright sunlight obtruded through the closed blinds, waking her up.
meanings.sent5: The smell of burnt popcorn obtruded into the room, making everyone cough.
